title: Fraternal Order Of Eagles font
content:
I realize there are 2 different fonts used here and the "F" and the "g" are oversized. I will settle for identification of either or both fonts, Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138im_/http:/typophile.com/files/foe-logo-3_4689.jpg)
author: wixyrick

comments.content:
Reminds me of Poor Richard (Eagles), especially if you use the alternate glyph for the g:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/poor-richard-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/poor-richard-rr/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/poor-richard-rr/")

Definitely in the same style, even if not a match....
Hand-lettering in the style of Samuel Welo or Fred Cooper...

Lettering.  
For similar letter \_g\_ consider Speedball by Intellecta Design [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/speedball/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/speedball/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/speedball/") Hacky Sack NF, a revival of Stunt Roman, [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/hacky-sack-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/hacky-sack-nf/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/hacky-sack-nf/")  
For the rest of \_Eagles\_ some of the flavor is in fonts by Greater Albion Typefounders such as Bonning [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/")  
Don

For \_a\_ consider Sweet Afton NF [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/sweet-afton-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/sweet-afton-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/sweet-afton-nf/") or Mrs. Bathurst NF [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/mrs-bathhurst/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/mrs-bathhurst/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/mrs-bathhurst/")  
Don

Some of the flavor, including \_a\_ and \_e\_ LHF Light Face Roman [http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/lightfaceroman.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075138/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/lightfaceroman.php "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/lightfaceroman.php")  
Don
Thanks. I also found Speedball and LHF Light Face Roman to be the closest.
